labels.analysis: The Tavily MCP Server is primarily focused on enabling real-time web search and intelligent data extraction for AI assistants. It provides tools for accessing up-to-date web information with advanced filtering and domain-specific capabilities. The available tools, tavily-search and tavily-extract, facilitate web data retrieval and processing, making it ideal for research tasks, content analysis, and data collection.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around accessing and processing web-based information, which aligns closely with search and research tasks. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is relevant due to the extraction and processing capabilities of the server. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.overview: Enable real-time web search and intelligent data extraction within your AI assistant by integrating Tavily's advanced search and extraction tools. Seamlessly access up-to-date web information with sophisticated filtering and domain-specific capabilities. Enhance your AI workflows with powerful web data retrieval and processing features.

tools.description: Deploy Server Tavily MCP Server @Rz017/tavily-mcp Try in Playground tavily-search

tools.name: tavily-extract
tools.description: A powerful web content extraction tool that retrieves and processes raw content from specified URLs, ideal for data collection, content analysis, and research tasks.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Rz017/tavily-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: tavilyApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for the Tavily MCP server.
